personas.name: American-Dream Ivan
personas.description: Immigrated from Soviet Ukraine in 1985 with almost nothing. Engineering degree wasn't recognized, so started as HVAC technician. Built company from scratch, now employs 25 people. Sees America as land of unlimited opportunity for those willing to work. Views lawsuits as weakness.
personas.tagline: I came to America with $50. Built a business. What's your excuse?
personas.archetypeWhatTheyBelieve: People are responsible for their own outcomes. Injuries happen because people weren't careful. Lawsuits are usually money grabs. Corporations create jobs and shouldn't be punished for every accident.
personas.archetypeDeliberationBehavior: Will argue plaintiff contributed to their own injury. Will minimize damages ('that's not worth a million dollars'). Will resist emotional appeals. Often vocal and may try to lead.

personas.instantRead: Immigrant success story. Extreme 'no excuses' mentality.

strikeOrKeep.defense_strategy: KEEP. Most effective Bootstrapper type.
strikeOrKeep.plaintiff_strategy: MUST STRIKE. His story will dominate deliberations.

personas.name: Widowed-And-Won Wanda
personas.description: Husband killed when scaffolding collapsed due to defective equipment. Sued company and won substantial verdict after 4-year fight. Experience made her believer in corporate accountability. Money didn't bring him back, but forced company to change.
personas.tagline: My husband died because a company cut corners. I sued and won. Justice is possible.
personas.archetypeWhatTheyBelieve: I've been through something similar. I know what this is really about. My experience tells me everything I need to know.
personas.archetypeDeliberationBehavior: Will project their experience onto the case. Will share personal story with high credibility. Nearly impossible to move from their position. Their verdict is set by their life, not the evidence.
archetypeHowToSpot: Mentions personal injury, lawsuit, or similar experience
Strong emotional reaction to case facts
Detailed knowledge of recovery or legal process
Phrases like 'I've been through this' or 'I know what that's like'
personas.instantRead: Lost spouse to corporate negligence, sued successfully. Maximum credibility.
phrasesYoullHear: My husband died because someone wanted to save money
No amount of money brings them back, but it forces companies to change
I know what it's like to fight a big corporation
These families deserve justice
It took four years, but it was worth it

verdictPrediction.special_note: IN WRONGFUL DEATH CASES: Her experience dominates deliberations.
verdictPrediction.damages_if_liability: Maximum. Justice requires it.
verdictPrediction.role_in_deliberation: Unassailable moral authority. Who argues with a widow?

strikeOrKeep.defense_strategy: CHALLENGE FOR CAUSE or STRIKE. You cannot overcome her story.
strikeOrKeep.plaintiff_strategy: KEEP. Especially in wrongful death - she's your most powerful voice.

personas.name: Wish-I-Had-Sued Wendy
personas.description: Seriously injured in car accident 5 years ago. Couldn't afford a lawyer, didn't understand her rights. Now regrets not suing - still has medical bills. Projects her situation onto plaintiffs. Wants to give them the justice she missed.
personas.tagline: I was hurt badly and couldn't afford a lawyer. I want to give them the justice I never got.
personas.archetypeWhatTheyBelieve: I've been through something similar. I know what this is really about. My experience tells me everything I need to know.
personas.archetypeDeliberationBehavior: Will project their experience onto the case. Will share personal story with high credibility. Nearly impossible to move from their position. Their verdict is set by their life, not the evidence.
archetypeHowToSpot: Mentions personal injury, lawsuit, or similar experience
Strong emotional reaction to case facts
Detailed knowledge of recovery or legal process
Phrases like 'I've been through this' or 'I know what that's like'
personas.instantRead: Was injured, couldn't sue. Vicarious justice seeker.
phrasesYoullHear: I wish I had known I could sue
I don't want this person to go through what I went through
I never got justice. Maybe they can.
The system didn't help me. We can help them.
I know how hard it is

verdictPrediction.damages_if_liability: High. Vicarious justice.
verdictPrediction.role_in_deliberation: Empathetic advocate. Will identify with plaintiff.

strikeOrKeep.defense_strategy: STRIKE. She's already emotionally invested in plaintiff winning.
strikeOrKeep.plaintiff_strategy: KEEP. She wants to give plaintiff what she couldn't get.

personas.name: Hidden-Grudge Grace
personas.description: Father died from environmental contamination at his workplace. Family couldn't afford to sue. Carries deep grudge against corporations. Presents as neutral sales manager. Doesn't mention father because she wants to be on jury and deliver justice.
personas.tagline: [In voir dire] 'I don't have any personal experience with this.' [Hidden] Father died from corporate contamination.
personas.archetypeWhatTheyBelieve: I have strong feelings about this, but if I share them, I won't be picked. So I'll say what they want to hear.
personas.archetypeDeliberationBehavior: Will seem reasonable early. Then reveals true position, which may be extreme. May be impossible to move once revealed. Can swing verdict unexpectedly.
archetypeHowToSpot: Answers that seem 'too perfect' or rehearsed
Evasive about relevant personal experiences
Inconsistencies between background and stated views
Seems eager to be on jury despite inconvenience
Occupation suggests strong views they're not expressing
personas.instantRead: Hiding family tragedy that makes her hostile to corporations.

verdictPrediction.damages_if_liability: Maximum. Vicarious justice for father.
verdictPrediction.role_in_deliberation: Will present as Scale-Balancer, then reveal as passionate plaintiff advocate.

strikeOrKeep.defense_strategy: DETECT through family history questions. STRIKE.
strikeOrKeep.plaintiff_strategy: KEEP if you detect her hidden experience.

personas.name: Stealth-Activist Adam
personas.description: Former environmental nonprofit employee. Left after burnout. Still deeply committed to holding corporations accountable. Lists occupation as 'solar installer' not 'environmental activist.' Gives neutral answers in voir dire but will reveal true views in deliberation.
personas.tagline: [In voir dire] 'I can be fair to both sides.' [In deliberation] 'Corporations should pay for what they do.'
personas.archetypeWhatTheyBelieve: I have strong feelings about this, but if I share them, I won't be picked. So I'll say what they want to hear.
personas.archetypeDeliberationBehavior: Will seem reasonable early. Then reveals true position, which may be extreme. May be impossible to move once revealed. Can swing verdict unexpectedly.
archetypeHowToSpot: Answers that seem 'too perfect' or rehearsed
Evasive about relevant personal experiences
Inconsistencies between background and stated views
Seems eager to be on jury despite inconvenience
Occupation suggests strong views they're not expressing
personas.instantRead: Presents as moderate but has hidden anti-corporate agenda.

verdictPrediction.damages_if_liability: Maximum including punitives.
verdictPrediction.role_in_deliberation: Will seem moderate early, then advocate strongly for plaintiff.

strikeOrKeep.defense_strategy: DETECT and STRIKE. His background tells the truth.
strikeOrKeep.plaintiff_strategy: KEEP if you detect him. Hidden ally.

personas.name: Tort-Reform Tony
personas.description: Owns insurance agency. His business profits from low verdicts. Active in tort reform advocacy but doesn't mention it. Gives measured answers in voir dire. Believes he CAN be fair - but his definition of 'fair' means finding for defense.
personas.tagline: [In voir dire] 'I'd follow the evidence.' [In deliberation] 'This is exactly the frivolous lawsuit we hear about.'
personas.archetypeWhatTheyBelieve: I have strong feelings about this, but if I share them, I won't be picked. So I'll say what they want to hear.
personas.archetypeDeliberationBehavior: Will seem reasonable early. Then reveals true position, which may be extreme. May be impossible to move once revealed. Can swing verdict unexpectedly.
archetypeHowToSpot: Answers that seem 'too perfect' or rehearsed
Evasive about relevant personal experiences
Inconsistencies between background and stated views
Seems eager to be on jury despite inconvenience
Occupation suggests strong views they're not expressing
personas.instantRead: Presents as neutral but deeply hostile to lawsuits.

verdictPrediction.damages_if_liability: Absolute minimum.
verdictPrediction.role_in_deliberation: Will seem reasonable, then reveal deep suspicion of plaintiff.

strikeOrKeep.defense_strategy: KEEP if you detect him. Hidden ally.
strikeOrKeep.plaintiff_strategy: DETECT and STRIKE. His livelihood depends on your client losing.
